head.title: Gordon Ramsay Spreads His Culinary Tentacles

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Hospitality, Restaurant and Travel

hedline.hl1: Gordon Ramsay Spreads His Culinary Tentacles

abstract.p: Celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay opens upscale pub, Narrow, in London's East End; plans to open another 'gastropub,' Warrington, in Maida Vale section of London later this year; photo (S)

block.p: Gordon Ramsay, the celebrity chef known for such food programs as ''Hell's Kitchen'' in the United States and ''The F-Word'' in Britain, has opened yet another eating establishment in a city already overpopulated with dining rooms bearing his brand. Adding to his roster of nine other London restaurants -- including one at Claridge's and another in the Savoy -- not to mention his outposts in New York, Dubai and Tokyo, Mr. Ramsay last month opened an upscale pub (above) on the banks of the Thames in the East End.

It is called the Narrow, and the menu features such dishes as potted Cromer crab and Gloucester pig cheeks with bashed neeps. Guests who don't fancy a pint of beer can always try the pub's original cocktails--though the Wallpaper (Cachaça, passion fruit, vanilla gomme and a touch of chili) sounds more like what the river just washed up than a tasty cocktail. What's next for Mr. Ramsay? Later this year he plans to open yet another ''gastropub,'' the Warrington, in the Maida Vale section of London.

Adding to his roster of nine other London restaurants -- including one at Claridge's and another in the Savoy -- not to mention his outposts in New York, Dubai and Tokyo, Mr. Ramsay last month opened an upscale pub (above) on the banks of the Thames in the East End.

It is called the Narrow, and the menu features such dishes as potted Cromer crab and Gloucester pig cheeks with bashed neeps. Guests who don't fancy a pint of beer can always try the pub's original cocktails--though the Wallpaper (Cachaça, passion fruit, vanilla gomme and a touch of chili) sounds more like what the river just washed up than a tasty cocktail. What's next for Mr. Ramsay? Later this year he plans to open yet another ''gastropub,'' the Warrington, in the Maida Vale section of London. IN TRANSIT
